basicInfo.parentCompany: Independent (privately held; founded by Jason Cohen and Ben Metcalfe; backed by Silver Lake Partners)
basicInfo.notes: Founded in 2010 by Jason Cohen (founder of SmartBear Software) and Ben Metcalfe in Austin, Texas. Acquired Flywheel in 2019 for ~$200M. Offices in Austin, San Antonio, London, Limerick (Ireland), Brisbane (Australia), and Krak√≥w (Poland). Known for proprietary EverCache technology. 201-1000 employees.

pricing.moneyBackExclusions: 60-day money-back guarantee; Custom enterprise plans may have different terms

policiesOverages.bandwidthOveragePolicy: 50GB included on Startup; $1-2 per 1,000 extra visitors; CDN overage $0.12/GB after 1,000GB
policiesOverages.accountSuspensionPolicy: Violation of ToS; non-payment; excessive resource usage
policiesOverages.resourceAbuseDefinition: Bandwidth/storage overage; prohibited plugins; malicious code
policiesOverages.hiddenFeesNotes: Premium pricing ($25+ minimum); No email hosting; Some plugins blocked for security; Overage charges possible; 60-day refund (excellent); Owns Flywheel brand too; PCI compliant (rare)

contentRestrictions.contentNotes: Blocks many plugins for security reasons; WordPress-only hosting

business.affiliateCommissionAmount: $200 per sale or 100% of first month; 60-day cookie

editorial.knownIssues: Premium pricing starts $25/month; Many plugins blocked for security; No email hosting; Some users report cancellation issues; Technical support quality reportedly declined; Mixed Trustpilot (3.5); Some 500 errors reported; Strict plugin restrictions frustrating for some
editorial.bestFor: Businesses needing PCI compliance for WordPress; Agencies with client sites; WooCommerce stores needing optimized performance; Sites needing phone support 24/7; Users wanting 60-day money-back guarantee; Enterprise WordPress deployments
editorial.avoidIf: Budget-conscious users; Need specific plugins that may be blocked; Want email hosting included; Prefer Kinsta's higher ratings; Need general web hosting
editorial.competitorComparisonNotes: 60-day refund (vs 30 days most competitors); Phone support available (unlike Kinsta); PCI compliant (rare feature); EverCache proprietary technology; Owns Flywheel; A+ BBB rating (good); G2 4.4 decent but Trustpilot 3.5 mixed; 20 data centers; Plugin restrictions more aggressive than competitors

comparisonData.uniqueSellingPoint: PCI-compliant managed WordPress with proprietary EverCache technology and 60-day money-back guarantee
comparisonData.idealCustomerProfile: Business needing PCI-compliant WordPress hosting with phone support and enterprise features

faqContent.faqIsThisHostGood: WP Engine is a premium managed WordPress host with PCI compliance and excellent security features. A+ BBB rating but mixed Trustpilot (3.5). Good for businesses needing compliance and phone support, though plugin restrictions can be frustrating.
faqContent.faqWhoOwnsThisHost: WP Engine is an independent company founded by Jason Cohen and Ben Metcalfe in 2010. Backed by Silver Lake Partners. They acquired Flywheel in 2019 for approximately $200M.
faqContent.faqHowMuchDoesItCost: WP Engine starts at $25/month for 1 site. Growth plan $59/month. Scale plan $200/month. Enterprise from $500/month. All plans include CDN, staging, and daily backups.
faqContent.faqIsItBeginnerFriendly: Moderately. The WP Engine Portal is user-friendly but plugin restrictions may confuse beginners. 24/7 phone and chat support helps.
faqContent.faqDoesItIncludeEmail: No, WP Engine does not include email hosting. They recommend third-party email services.
faqContent.faqCanIHostWordPress: Yes, WP Engine is WordPress-only hosting with proprietary EverCache technology, staging environments, and automatic updates.
faqContent.faqWhatsTheUptime: WP Engine guarantees 99.95% uptime (slightly higher than standard 99.9%) with SLA credits for downtime.
faqContent.faqCanICancelAnytime: Yes, with a generous 60-day money-back guarantee - one of the longest in the industry. Monthly billing available.
